citation.article-title: Lentibacillus salarius sp. nov., isolated from saline sediment in China, and emended description of the genus Lentibacillus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Lentibacillus Yoon et al. 2002
Lentibacillus (Len.ti.ba.cil′lus. L. adj. lentus slow; L. dim. n. bacillus small rod; N.L. masc. n. Lentibacillus slowly growing bacillus).
Spherical or oval endospores lie terminally in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are cream-coloured, smooth and circular to slightly irregular.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA is in the range 42–44 mol%.
The type species is Lentibacillus salicampi.
